means: 壮健的，肌肉发达的，强壮的

sentence.Network_en: He was wearing shorts which showed his long, muscular, hairy legs.
sentence.Network_cn: 他穿着短裤，露出自己强壮多毛的长腿。

sentence.Network_en: Foods and fluids are mixed in the stomach by its muscular contractions.
sentence.Network_cn: 通过胃部肌肉的收缩食物和流质在胃中混合。

sentence.Network_en: A muscular spasm in the coronary artery can cause a heart attack.
sentence.Network_cn: 冠状动脉的肌肉痉挛可能导致心脏病。

means.word_mean: 勤奋的,积极的,敢做敢为的
肌肉发达的,强健的,结实的,强有力的

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 17th cent.: alteration of earlier musculous, in the same sense

entry.def: Muscular means involving or affecting your muscles.

example.ex: As a general rule, all muscular effort is enhanced by breathing in as the effort is made...
example.tran: 通常，肌肉的力量能通过使劲儿吸气增强。

example.ex: Early symptoms include anorexia, muscular weakness and fatigue.
example.tran: 早期症状有厌食、肌无力和疲劳。

entry.def: If a person or their body is muscular, they are very fit and strong, and have firm muscles which are not covered with a lot of fat.

example.ex: Like most female athletes, she was lean and muscular.
example.tran: 像大多女运动员一样，她清瘦但肌肉发达。
他那肌肉发达、肤色黝黑的双腿

means.word_mean: 1. of or relating to or consisting of muscle;
2. having a robust muscular body-build characterized by predominance of structures (bone and muscle and connective tissue) developed from the embryonic mesodermal layer
3. having or suggesting great physical power or force;
4. (of a person) possessing physical strength and weight; rugged and powerful;
